metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from monitoring of privileged escalation containers
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from evaluation of privileged escalation containers in Kubernetes clusters. To list multiple namespaces, use semicolons (;) to separate them.

metadata.displayName: Containers sharing sensitive host namespaces should be avoided
metadata.description: Enable or disable monitoring of shared sensitive host namespaces in Kubernetes clusters

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from monitoring of sharing sensitive host namespaces in Kubernetes clusters
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from evaluation of  sharing sensitive host namespaces in Kubernetes clusters. To list multiple namespaces, use semicolons (;) to separate them.

metadata.displayName: Immutable (read-only) root filesystem should be enforced for containers
metadata.description: Enable or disable monitoring of containers running with a read only root file system in Kubernetes clusters

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from monitoring of containers running with a read only root file system
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from evaluation to monitoring of containers running with a read only root file system in Kubernetes clusters. To list multiple namespaces, use semicolons (;) to separate them.

metadata.displayName: Least privileged Linux capabilities should be enforced for containers
metadata.description: Enable or disable monitoring of Kubernetes containers using allowed capabilities only

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from monitoring of containers use only allowed capabilities
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from evaluation to monitoring of containers using only allowed capabilities in Kubernetes clusters. To list multiple namespaces, use semicolons (;) to separate them.

metadata.displayName: Allowed capabilities
metadata.description: The list of capabilities that are allowed to be added to a container. Provide empty list as input to block everything.

metadata.displayName: Required drop capabilities
metadata.description: The list of capabilities that must be dropped by a container.

metadata.displayName: Overriding or disabling of containers AppArmor profile should be restricted
metadata.description: Enable or disable monitoring of modification of Kubernetes containers' AppArmor profile

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from monitoring of containers modification of AppArmor profile
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from evaluation to monitoring of containers modifying of AppArmor profile in Kubernetes clusters. To list multiple namespaces, use semicolons (;) to separate them.

metadata.displayName: Allowed AppArmor profiles
metadata.description: The list of AppArmor profiles that containers are allowed to use. E.g. 'runtime/default;docker/default'. Provide empty list as input to block everything.

metadata.displayName: Usage of host networking and ports should be restricted
metadata.description: Enable or disable monitoring of Kubernetes containers' host networking and port ranges

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from monitoring of containers host networking and ports
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from evaluation to monitoring of containers host networking and ports in Kubernetes clusters. To list multiple namespaces, use semicolons (;) to separate them.

metadata.displayName: Allow host network usage
metadata.description: Set this value to true if pod is allowed to use host network otherwise false.

metadata.displayName: Min host port
metadata.description: The minimum value in the allowable host port range that pods can use in the host network namespace.

metadata.displayName: Max host port
metadata.description: The maximum value in the allowable host port range that pods can use in the host network namespace.

metadata.displayName: Usage of pod HostPath volume mounts should be restricted to a known list to restrict node access from compromised containers
metadata.description: Enable or disable monitoring of pod HostPath volume mounts in Kubernetes clusters

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from monitoring of pod HostPath volume mounts
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from evaluation to monitoring of pod HostPath volume mounts in Kubernetes clusters. To list multiple namespaces, use semicolons (;) to separate them.

metadata.displayName: Allowed host paths
metadata.description: The host paths allowed for pod hostPath volumes to use. Provide an empty paths list to block all host paths.

metadata.displayName: Containers' CPU and memory limits should be enforced
metadata.description: Enable or disable monitoring of containers' CPU and memory limits in Kubernetes clusters

metadata.displayName: Max allowed memory bytes in Kubernetes cluster
metadata.description: The maximum memory bytes allowed for a container. E.g. 1Gi. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Max allowed CPU units in Kubernetes cluster
metadata.description: The maximum CPU units allowed for a container. E.g. 200m. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from monitoring of memory and CPU limits
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from evaluation of memory and CPU limits in Kubernetes clusters. To list multiple namespaces, use semicolons (;) to separate them.

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Should connect to remote host
metadata.description: Must be 'True' or 'False'. 'True' indicates that the virtual machine should be able to establish a connection with the remote host specified, so the machine will be non-compliant if it cannot establish a connection. 'False' indicates that the virtual machine should not be able to establish a connection with the remote host specified, so the machine will be non-compliant if it can establish a connection.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: System settings: Use Certificate Rules on Windows Executables for Software Restriction Policies
metadata.description: Specifies whether digital certificates are processed when software restriction policies are enabled and a user or process attempts to run software with an .exe file name extension. It enables or disables certificate rules (a type of software restriction policies rule). For certificate rules to take effect in software restriction policies, you must enable this policy setting.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Vulnerabilities should be remediated by a Vulnerability Assessment solution
metadata.description: Enable or disable the detection of VM vulnerabilities by a vulnerability assessment solution

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may access this computer from the network
metadata.description: Specifies which remote users on the network are permitted to connect to the computer. This does not include Remote Desktop Connection.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may log on locally
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups can interactively log on to the computer. Users who attempt to log on via Remote Desktop Connection or IIS also require this user right.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may log on through Remote Desktop Services
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups are permitted to log on as a Terminal Services client, Remote Desktop, or for Remote Assistance.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that are denied access from the network
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups are explicitly prohibited from connecting across the network.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may manage auditing and security log
metadata.description: Specifies users and groups permitted to change the auditing options for files and directories and clear the Security log.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may back up files and directories
metadata.description: Specifies users and groups allowed to circumvent file and directory permissions to back up the system.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may change the system time
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to change the time and date on the internal clock of the computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may change the time zone
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to change the time zone of the computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may create a token object
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to create an access token, which may provide elevated rights to access sensitive data.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that are denied logging on as a batch job
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer as a batch job (i.e. scheduled task).

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that are denied logging on as a service
metadata.description: Specifies which service accounts are explicitly not permitted to register a process as a service.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that are denied local logon
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that are denied log on through Remote Desktop Services
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer via Terminal Services/Remote Desktop Client.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: User and groups that may force shutdown from a remote system
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to shut down the computer from a remote location on the network.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that may restore files and directories
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions when restoring backed up files and directories.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that may shut down the system
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups who are logged on locally to the computers in your environment are permitted to shut down the operating system with the Shut Down command.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may take ownership of files or other objects
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to take ownership of files, folders, registry keys, processes, or threads. This user right bypasses any permissions that are in place to protect objects to give ownership to the specified user.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: System updates should be installed on your machines

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Use profile settings
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Domain profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Domain profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Use profile settings
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Private profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Private profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Use profile settings
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Public profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Public profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall: Domain: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall: Private: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall: Public: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: MFA should be enabled on accounts with write permissions in your subscription
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of MFA for accounts with write permissions in subscription

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: All authorization rules except RootManageSharedAccessKey should be removed from Service Bus namespace
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of Service Bus namespace authorization rules

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) should be used on Kubernetes Services
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of Kubernetes Services without RBAC enabled

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Diagnostic logs in Search services should be enabled
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of diagnostic logs in Azure Search service

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always)
metadata.description: Specifies whether packet signing is required by the SMB client component.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network client: Send unencrypted password to third-party SMB servers
metadata.description: Specifies whether the SMB redirector will send plaintext passwords during authentication to third-party SMB servers that do not support password encryption. It is recommended that you disable this policy setting unless there is a strong business case to enable it.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session
metadata.description: Specifies the amount of continuous idle time that must pass in an SMB session before the session is suspended because of inactivity. The format of the value is two integers separated by a comma, denoting an inclusive range.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)
metadata.description: Specifies whether packet signing is required by the SMB server component.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire
metadata.description: Specifies whether to disconnect users who are connected to the local computer outside their user account's valid logon hours. This setting affects the Server Message Block (SMB) component. If you enable this policy setting you should also enable 'Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire'

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: IP Forwarding on your virtual machine should be disabled
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of IP forwarding on virtual machines

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Advanced Threat Protection types should be set to 'All' in SQL Managed Instance advanced data security settings
metadata.description: It's recommended to enable all Advanced Threat Protection types on your SQL Managed Instance. Enabling all types protects against SQL injection, database vulnerabilities, and any other anomalous activities.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Certificate store path containing the certificates to be checked for expiration
metadata.description: The path to the certificate store containing the certificates to check the expiration dates of. Default value is 'Cert:' which is the root certificate store path, so all certificates on the machine will be checked. Other example paths: 'Cert:\LocalMachine', 'Cert:\LocalMachine\TrustedPublisher', 'Cert:\CurrentUser'

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Expiration limit in days for certificates that are expiring under specified certificate store path
metadata.description: An integer indicating the number of days within which to check for certificates that are expiring. For example, if this value is 30, any certificate expiring within the next 30 days will cause this policy to be non-compliant.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Certificate thumbprints to include while checking for expired certificates under specified certificate store path
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of certificate thumbprints to check under the specified path. If a value is not specified, all certificates under the certificate store path will be checked. If a value is specified, no certificates other than those with the thumbprints specified will be checked. e.g. THUMBPRINT1;THUMBPRINT2;THUMBPRINT3

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Certificate thumbprints to exclude while checking for expired certificates under specified certificate store path
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of certificate thumbprints to ignore while checking expired certificates. e.g. THUMBPRINT1;THUMBPRINT2;THUMBPRINT3

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Include already expired certificates while checking for expired certificates under specified certificate store path
metadata.description: Must be 'true' or 'false'. True indicates that any found certificates that have already expired will also make this policy non-compliant. False indicates that certificates that have expired will be be ignored under specified certificate store path.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and all folders
metadata.description: Specifies whether to make the Recovery Console SET command available, which allows setting of recovery console environment variables.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Accounts: Guest account status
metadata.description: Specifies whether the local Guest account is disabled.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub-paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths and sub-paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously
metadata.description: Specifies which network shares can be accessed by anonymous users. The default configuration for this policy setting has little effect because all users have to be authenticated before they can access shared resources on the server.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: External accounts with owner permissions should be removed from your subscription
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of external acounts with owner permissions in subscription

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Vulnerabilities on your SQL databases should be remediated
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of Vulnerability Assessment scan results and recommendations for how to remediate database vulnerabilities.

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: State in which to show VMs on which Windows Defender Exploit Guard is not available
metadata.description: Windows Defender Exploit Guard is only available starting with Windows 10/Windows Server with update 1709. Setting this value to 'Non-Compliant' will make machines with older versions on which Windows Defender Exploit Guard is not available (such as Windows Server 2012 R2) non-compliant. Setting this value to 'Compliant' will make these machines compliant.

metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Public profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Public profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall: Domain: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall: Private: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall: Public: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Required retention (in days) of logs in Data Lake Store accounts
metadata.description: The required diagnostic logs retention period in days

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: [Only secure connections to your Redis Cache should be enabled]
metadata.description: Azure Policy effect for this policy; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: [Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled]
metadata.description: Azure Policy effect for this policy; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may access this computer from the network
metadata.description: Specifies which remote users on the network are permitted to connect to the computer. This does not include Remote Desktop Connection.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may log on locally
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups can interactively log on to the computer. Users who attempt to log on via Remote Desktop Connection or IIS also require this user right.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may log on through Remote Desktop Services
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups are permitted to log on as a Terminal Services client, Remote Desktop, or for Remote Assistance.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied access from the network
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups are explicitly prohibited from connecting across the network.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may manage auditing and security log
metadata.description: Specifies users and groups permitted to change the auditing options for files and directories and clear the Security log.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may back up files and directories
metadata.description: Specifies users and groups allowed to circumvent file and directory permissions to back up the system.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may change the system time
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to change the time and date on the internal clock of the computer.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may change the time zone
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to change the time zone of the computer.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may create a token object
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to create an access token, which may provide elevated rights to access sensitive data.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied logging on as a batch job
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer as a batch job (i.e. scheduled task).

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied logging on as a service
metadata.description: Specifies which service accounts are explicitly not permitted to register a process as a service.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied local logon
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied log on through Remote Desktop Services
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer via Terminal Services/Remote Desktop Client.

metadata.displayName: User and groups that may force shutdown from a remote system
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to shut down the computer from a remote location on the network.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that may restore files and directories
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions when restoring backed up files and directories.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that may shut down the system
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups who are logged on locally to the computers in your environment are permitted to shut down the operating system with the Shut Down command.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may take ownership of files or other objects
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to take ownership of files, folders, registry keys, processes, or threads. This user right bypasses any permissions that are in place to protect objects to give ownership to the specified user.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: [Virtual machines should be connected to an approved virtual network]
metadata.description: Azure Policy effect for this policy; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: UAC: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of Admin Approval Mode for the built-in Administrator account.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of application installation detection for the computer.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of all User Account Control (UAC) policy settings for the computer.

properties.displayName: [Preview]: Kubernetes cluster pod security baseline standards for Linux-based workloads
properties.description: This initiative includes the policies for the Kubernetes cluster pod security baseline standards. For instructions on using this policy, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Effect
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Namespace exclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation.

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Audit Windows Server VMs on which Windows Serial Console is not enabled
properties.description: This initiative deploys the policy requirements and audits Windows Server virtual machines on which Windows Serial Console is not enabled. For more information on Guest Configuration policies, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpol

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: EMS Port Number
metadata.description: An integer indicating the COM port to be used for the Emergency Management Services (EMS) console redirection. For more information on EMS settings, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpolwsc

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: EMS Baud Rate
metadata.description: An integer indicating the baud rate to be used for the Emergency Management Services (EMS) console redirection. For more information on EMS settings, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpolwsc

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Audit Windows VMs in which the Administrators group contains any of the specified members
properties.description: This initiative deploys the policy requirements and audits Windows virtual machines in which the Administrators group contains any of the specified members. For more information on Guest Configuration policies, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpol

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Members to exclude
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of members that should be excluded in the Administrators local group. Ex: Administrator; myUser1; myUser2

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Audit Windows VMs that contain certificates expiring within the specified number of days
properties.description: This initiative deploys the policy requirements and audits Windows virtual machines that contain certificates expiring within the specified number of days. For more information on Guest Configuration policies, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpol

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Certificate store path
metadata.description: The path to the certificate store containing the certificates to check the expiration dates of. Default value is 'Cert:' which is the root certificate store path, so all certificates on the machine will be checked. Other example paths: 'Cert:\LocalMachine', 'Cert:\LocalMachine\TrustedPublisher', 'Cert:\CurrentUser'

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Expiration limit in days
metadata.description: An integer indicating the number of days within which to check for certificates that are expiring. For example, if this value is 30, any certificate expiring within the next 30 days will cause this policy to be non-compliant.

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Certificate thumbprints to include
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of certificate thumbprints to check under the specified path. If a value is not specified, all certificates under the certificate store path will be checked. If a value is specified, no certificates other than those with the thumbprints specified will be checked. e.g. THUMBPRINT1;THUMBPRINT2;THUMBPRINT3

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Certificate thumbprints to exclude
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of certificate thumbprints to ignore. e.g. THUMBPRINT1;THUMBPRINT2;THUMBPRINT3

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Include expired certificates
metadata.description: Must be 'true' or 'false'. True indicates that any found certificates that have already expired will also make this policy non-compliant. False indicates that certificates that have expired will be be ignored.

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Audit Windows VMs that have not restarted within the specified number of days
properties.description: This initiative deploys the policy requirements and audits Windows virtual machines that have not restarted within the specified number of days. For more information on Guest Configuration policies, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpol

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Number of days
metadata.description: The number of days without restart until the machine is considered non-compliant

properties.displayName: [Preview]: Windows machines should meet requirements for the Azure security baseline
properties.description: This initiative audits Windows machines with settings that do not meet the Azure security baseline. For details, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpol

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Enable insecure guest logons
metadata.description: Specifies whether the SMB client will allow insecure guest logons to an SMB server.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Allow simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain
metadata.description: Specify whether to prevent computers from connecting to both a domain based network and a non-domain based network at the same time. A value of 0 allows simultaneous connections, and a value of 1 blocks them.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Turn off multicast name resolution
metadata.description: Specifies whether LLMNR, a secondary name resolution protocol that transmits using multicast over a local subnet link on a single subnet, is enabled.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Always use classic logon
metadata.description: Specifies whether to force the user to log on to the computer using the classic logon screen. This setting only works when the computer is not on a domain.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy
metadata.description: Specifies which boot-start drivers are initialized based on a classification determined by an Early Launch Antimalware boot-start driver.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Enable Windows NTP Client
metadata.description: Specifies whether the Windows NTP Client is enabled. Enabling the Windows NTP Client allows your computer to synchronize its computer clock with other NTP servers.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Turn on convenience PIN sign-in
metadata.description: Specifies whether a domain user can sign in using a convenience PIN.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Accounts: Guest account status
metadata.description: Specifies whether the local Guest account is disabled.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit: Shut down system immediately if unable to log security audits
metadata.description: Audits if the system will shut down when unable to log Security events.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Devices: Allowed to format and eject removable media
metadata.description: Specifies who is allowed to format and eject removable NTFS media. You can use this policy setting to prevent unauthorized users from removing data on one computer to access it on another computer on which they have local administrator privileges.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always)
metadata.description: Specifies whether packet signing is required by the SMB client component.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network client: Send unencrypted password to third-party SMB servers
metadata.description: Specifies whether the SMB redirector will send plaintext passwords during authentication to third-party SMB servers that do not support password encryption. It is recommended that you disable this policy setting unless there is a strong business case to enable it.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session
metadata.description: Specifies the amount of continuous idle time that must pass in an SMB session before the session is suspended because of inactivity. The format of the value is two integers separated by a comma, denoting an inclusive range.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)
metadata.description: Specifies whether packet signing is required by the SMB server component.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire
metadata.description: Specifies whether to disconnect users who are connected to the local computer outside their user account's valid logon hours. This setting affects the Server Message Block (SMB) component. If you enable this policy setting you should also enable 'Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire'

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub-paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths and sub-paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously
metadata.description: Specifies which network shares can be accessed by anonymous users. The default configuration for this policy setting has little effect because all users have to be authenticated before they can access shared resources on the server.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos
metadata.description: Specifies the encryption types that Kerberos is allowed to use.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network security: LAN Manager authentication level
metadata.description: Specify which challenge-response authentication protocol is used for network logons. This choice affects the level of authentication protocol used by clients, the level of session security negotiated, and the level of authentication accepted by servers.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network security: LDAP client signing requirements
metadata.description: Specify the level of data signing that is requested on behalf of clients that issue LDAP BIND requests.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by clients for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/security-policy-settings/network-security-minimum-session-security-for-ntlm-ssp-based-including-secure-rpc-servers for more information.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by servers for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and all folders
metadata.description: Specifies whether to make the Recovery Console SET command available, which allows setting of recovery console environment variables.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Shutdown: Allow system to be shut down without having to log on
metadata.description: Specifies whether a computer can be shut down when a user is not logged on. If this policy setting is enabled, the shutdown command is available on the Windows logon screen.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Shutdown: Clear virtual memory pagefile
metadata.description: Specifies whether the virtual memory pagefile is cleared when the system is shut down. When this policy setting is enabled, the system pagefile is cleared each time that the system shuts down properly. For systems with large amounts of RAM, this could result in substantial time needed to complete the shutdown.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: System settings: Use Certificate Rules on Windows Executables for Software Restriction Policies
metadata.description: Specifies whether digital certificates are processed when software restriction policies are enabled and a user or process attempts to run software with an .exe file name extension. It enables or disables certificate rules (a type of software restriction policies rule). For certificate rules to take effect in software restriction policies, you must enable this policy setting.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: UAC: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of Admin Approval Mode for the built-in Administrator account.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: UAC: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: UAC: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of application installation detection for the computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: UAC: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of all User Account Control (UAC) policy settings for the computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Enforce password history
metadata.description: Specifies limits on password reuse - how many times a new password must be created for a user account before the password can be repeated.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Maximum password age
metadata.description: Specifies the maximum number of days that may elapse before a user account password must be changed. The format of the value is two integers separated by a comma, denoting an inclusive range.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Minimum password age
metadata.description: Specifies the minimum number of days that must elapse before a user account password can be changed.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Minimum password length
metadata.description: Specifies the minimum number of characters that a user account password may contain.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Password must meet complexity requirements
metadata.description: Specifies whether a user account password must be complex. If required, a complex password must not contain part of  user's account name or full name; be at least 6 characters long; contain a mix of uppercase, lowercase, number, and non-alphabetic characters.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit Credential Validation
metadata.description: Specifies whether audit events are generated when credentials are submitted for a user account logon request.  This setting is especially useful for monitoring unsuccessful attempts, to find brute-force attacks, account enumeration, and potential account compromise events on domain controllers.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit Process Termination
metadata.description: Specifies whether audit events are generated when a process has exited. Recommended for monitoring termination of critical processes.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit Group Membership
metadata.description: Specifies whether audit events are generated when group memberships are enumerated on the client computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit Detailed File Share
metadata.description: If this policy setting is enabled, access to all shared files and folders on the system is audited. Auditing for Success can lead to very high volumes of events.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit File Share
metadata.description: Specifies whether to audit events related to file shares: creation, deletion, modification, and access attempts. Also, it shows failed SMB SPN checks. Event volumes can be high on DCs and File Servers.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit File System
metadata.description: Specifies whether audit events are generated when users attempt to access file system objects. Audit events are generated only for objects that have configured system access control lists (SACLs).

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit Authentication Policy Change
metadata.description: Specifies whether audit events are generated when changes are made to authentication policy. This setting is useful for tracking changes in domain-level and forest-level trust and privileges that are granted to user accounts or groups.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit Authorization Policy Change
metadata.description: Specifies whether audit events are generated for assignment and removal of user rights in user right policies, changes in security token object permission, resource attributes changes and Central Access Policy changes for file system objects.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Audit Other System Events
metadata.description: Specifies whether audit events are generated for Windows Firewall Service and Windows Firewall driver start and stop events, failure events for these services and Windows Firewall Service policy processing failures.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may access this computer from the network
metadata.description: Specifies which remote users on the network are permitted to connect to the computer. This does not include Remote Desktop Connection.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may log on locally
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups can interactively log on to the computer. Users who attempt to log on via Remote Desktop Connection or IIS also require this user right.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may log on through Remote Desktop Services

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may manage auditing and security log
metadata.description: Specifies users and groups permitted to change the auditing options for files and directories and clear the Security log.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may back up files and directories
metadata.description: Specifies users and groups allowed to circumvent file and directory permissions to back up the system.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may change the system time
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to change the time and date on the internal clock of the computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may change the time zone
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to change the time zone of the computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may create a token object
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to create an access token, which may provide elevated rights to access sensitive data.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that are denied logging on as a batch job
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer as a batch job (i.e. scheduled task).

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that are denied logging on as a service
metadata.description: Specifies which service accounts are explicitly not permitted to register a process as a service.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that are denied local logon
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that are denied log on through Remote Desktop Services
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer via Terminal Services/Remote Desktop Client.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: User and groups that may force shutdown from a remote system
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to shut down the computer from a remote location on the network.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that may restore files and directories
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions when restoring backed up files and directories.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users and groups that may shut down the system
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups who are logged on locally to the computers in your environment are permitted to shut down the operating system with the Shut Down command.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Users or groups that may take ownership of files or other objects
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to take ownership of files, folders, registry keys, processes, or threads. This user right bypasses any permissions that are in place to protect objects to give ownership to the specified user.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Send file samples when further analysis is required
metadata.description: Specifies whether and how Windows Defender will submit samples of suspected malware  to Microsoft for further analysis when opt-in for MAPS telemetry is set.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Allow indexing of encrypted files
metadata.description: Specifies whether encrypted items are allowed to be indexed.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Allow Telemetry
metadata.description: Specifies configuration of the amount of diagnostic and usage data reported to Microsoft. The data is transmitted securely and sensitive data is not sent.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Allow unencrypted traffic
metadata.description: Specifies whether the Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service sends and receives unencrypted messages over the network.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Always install with elevated privileges
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Installer should use system permissions when it installs any program on the system.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Always prompt for password upon connection
metadata.description: Specifies whether Terminal Services/Remote Desktop Connection always prompts the client computer for a password upon connection.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Application: Specify the maximum log file size (KB)
metadata.description: Specifies the maximum size for the Application event log in kilobytes.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Automatically send memory dumps for OS-generated error reports
metadata.description: Specifies if memory dumps in support of OS-generated error reports can be sent to Microsoft automatically.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Configure Default consent
metadata.description: Specifies setting of the default consent handling for error reports sent to Microsoft.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Configure Windows SmartScreen
metadata.description: Specifies how to manage the behavior of Windows SmartScreen. Windows SmartScreen helps keep PCs safer by warning users before running unrecognized programs downloaded from the Internet. Some information is sent to Microsoft about files and programs run on PCs with this feature enabled.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Disallow Digest authentication
metadata.description: Specifies whether the Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client will not use Digest authentication.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Disallow WinRM from storing RunAs credentials
metadata.description: Specifies whether the Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service will not allow RunAs credentials to be stored for any plug-ins.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Do not allow passwords to be saved
metadata.description: Specifies whether to prevent Remote Desktop Services - Terminal Services clients from saving passwords on a computer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Security: Specify the maximum log file size (KB)
metadata.description: Specifies the maximum size for the Security event log in kilobytes.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Set client connection encryption level
metadata.description: Specifies whether to require the use of a specific encryption level to secure communications between client computers and RD Session Host servers during Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) connections. This policy only applies when you are using native RDP encryption.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Set the default behavior for AutoRun
metadata.description: Specifies the default behavior for Autorun commands. Autorun commands are generally stored in autorun.inf files. They often launch the installation program or other routines.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Setup: Specify the maximum log file size (KB)
metadata.description: Specifies the maximum size for the Setup event log in kilobytes.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: System: Specify the maximum log file size (KB)
metadata.description: Specifies the maximum size for the System event log in kilobytes.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer
metadata.description: Specifies whether to turn off Data Execution Prevention for Windows File Explorer. Disabling data execution prevention can allow certain legacy plug-in applications to function without terminating Explorer.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Specify the interval to check for definition updates
metadata.description: Specifies an interval at which to check for Windows Defender definition updates. The time value is represented as the number of hours between update checks.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Use profile settings
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Domain profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Domain profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Domain): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Use profile settings
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Private profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Private profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Private): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Use profile settings
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Public profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Public profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall (Public): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall: Domain: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: [Preview]: Windows Firewall: Private: Allow unicast response

metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Public profile.

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Audit Linux VMs that do not have the specified applications installed
properties.description: This initiative deploys the policy requirements and audits Linux virtual machines that do not have the specified applications installed. For more information on Guest Configuration policies, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpol

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Application names
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of the names of the applications that should be installed. e.g. 'python; powershell'

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Audit Windows VMs with a pending reboot
properties.description: This initiative deploys the policy requirements and audits Windows virtual machines with a pending reboot. For more information on Guest Configuration policies, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpol

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: PowerShell Modules
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of the names of the PowerShell modules that should be installed. You may also specify a specific version of a module that should be installed by including a comma after the module name, followed by the desired version. e.g. PSDscResources; SqlServerDsc, 12.0.0.0; ComputerManagementDsc, 6.1.0.0

properties.displayName: Enable Azure Cosmos DB throughput policy
properties.description: Enable throughput control for Azure Cosmos DB resources in the specified scope (Management group, Subscription or resource group). Takes max throughput as parameter. Use this policy to help enforce throughput control via the resource provider.

metadata.displayName: Max RUs
metadata.description: The maximum throughput (RU/s) that can be assigned to a container via the Resource Provider during create or update.

metadata.displayName: Policy Effect
metadata.description: The desired effect of the throughput limit policy. The key based metadata write access policy is always enforced.

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Audit Windows VMs that do not contain the specified certificates in Trusted Root
properties.description: This initiative deploys the policy requirements and audits Windows VMs that do not contain the specified certificates in the Trusted Root Certification Authorities certificate store (Cert:\LocalMachine\Root). For more information on Guest Configuration policies, please visit https://aka.ms/gcpol

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Certificate thumbprints
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of certificate thumbprints that should exist under the Trusted Root certificate store (Cert:\LocalMachine\Root). e.g. THUMBPRINT1;THUMBPRINT2;THUMBPRINT3

properties.displayName: NIST SP 800-53 R4
properties.description: This initiative includes audit and virtual machine extension deployment policies that address a subset of NIST SP 800-53 R4 controls. Additional policies will be added in upcoming releases. For more information, visit https://aka.ms/nist80053-blueprint.

metadata.description: This policy enables you to restrict the locations your organization can create resource groups in or deploy resources. Use to enforce your geo-compliance requirements. Excludes resource groups, Microsoft.AzureActiveDirectory/b2cDirectories, and resources that use the 'global' region.

metadata.displayName: Members to be included in the Administrators local group
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of members that should be included in the Administrators local group. Ex: Administrator; myUser1; myUser2

metadata.displayName: Members that should be excluded in the Administrators local group

metadata.displayName: Log Analytics Workspace Id that VMs should be configured for

metadata.displayName: Function App should only be accessible over HTTPS

metadata.displayName: External accounts with write permissions should be removed from your subscription
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of external acounts with write permissions in subscription

metadata.displayName: External accounts with read permissions should be removed from your subscription
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of external acounts with read permissions in subscription

metadata.displayName: External accounts with owner permissions should be removed from your subscription
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of external acounts with owner permissions in subscription

metadata.displayName: Deprecated accounts with owner permissions should be removed from your subscription
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of deprecated acounts with owner permissions in subscription

metadata.displayName: Deprecated accounts should be removed from your subscription
metadata.description: Enable or disable the monitoring of deprecated acounts in subscription

metadata.displayName: System updates on virtual machine scale sets should be installed
